meanings.definition: Entice or persuade someone to do something they may regret.
meanings.sent1: The delicious smell of freshly baked cookies tempts me to eat them all.
meanings.sent2: The shiny new toy in the store window tempts children to beg their parents for it.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tempts the dog by running just out of reach.
meanings.sent4: The forbidden fruit on the tree tempts Eve to take a bite.
meanings.sent5: The tempting offer of free samples lures customers into the store.

meanings.definition: To attract or allure someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: The colorful display of flowers tempts bees to come and pollinate them.
meanings.sent2: The promise of adventure tempts travelers to explore new places.
meanings.sent3: The smell of popcorn tempts moviegoers to buy a snack.
meanings.sent4: The sound of laughter tempts people to join in the fun.
meanings.sent5: The warm sun tempts beachgoers to take a swim in the ocean.
